item.title: Evolution of multi case switch statements
item.description: Daily Knowledge Drop There are numerous ways of handling the multiple case switch statement/expression in C#, and these various methods have evolved over time as C# language features have been introduced and enhanced. Today we’ll look at a few of these ways, specifically around having multiple cases returning the same result. Switch statement With the traditional switch statement, each case needs to be specified explicitly (except for the default case).
